# Zoho Desk APIs for Postman

[![Run in Postman](https://run.pstmn.io/button.svg)](https://god.gw.postman.com/run-collection/7584004-bc554b53-8d7a-43b1-a366-ed2cee6401f1?action=collection%2Ffork&collection-url=entityId%3D7584004-bc554b53-8d7a-43b1-a366-ed2cee6401f1%26entityType%3Dcollection%26workspaceId%3Dddd3ba1e-c1f5-4ccb-82d1-a18ff3e876e2#?env%5BZoho%20Desk%20Environment%)

This is a Postman collection covering the Zoho Desk API.

### Disclaimer

- This collection is not by any means officially supported by Zoho Desk.
- Visit [Zoho Desk Developer APIs forum](https://help.zoho.com/portal/en/community/zoho-desk/zoho-desk-developer-apis) for any API queries.
- Also refer [official API documentation](https://desk.zoho.com/DeskAPIDocument) for more details.

## Getting Started

To get started, you could either fork the collection from the Postman's workspace or import the collections JSON file from this repository into postman.

### How to Fork collections from Postman

- Fork the collection from the [public workspace](https://www.postman.com/imohanvadivel/workspace/zoho-desk/overview) within postman.

  ![Fork the collection](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/imohanvadivel/zoho-desk-postman/main/images/Frk_1.png)

- Enter a name for your fork and select the workspace where it will be created.

  ![Enter name and workspace](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/imohanvadivel/zoho-desk-postman/main/images/Frk_2.png)

- Similarly click on the `Environments` tab and fork the environment template.

  ![Fork environment](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/imohanvadivel/zoho-desk-postman/main/images/Frk_3.png)

- You should now see the Zoho Desk API collection and environment in your selected workspace.

  ![Collection pane](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/imohanvadivel/zoho-desk-postman/main/images/Frk_4.png)

- Update the environment variables with your secret keys and save.

  ![Update Environment Variables](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/imohanvadivel/zoho-desk-postman/main/images/Frk_5.png)

- Set the environment to active.

  ![Set environment to active](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/imohanvadivel/zoho-desk-postman/main/images/Frk_6.png)

You are now up and running with Zoho Desk API collections.

---

### How to import collections to Postman

- Download the [zoho-desk-postman](https://github.com/imohanvadivel/zoho-desk-postman) repository.

- Open your preferred workspace in the Postman app and click on the top-left `Import` button.

  ![import the collection](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/imohanvadivel/zoho-desk-postman/main/images/Imp_1.png)

- On the import pop-up page, select the `folder` tab and choose the root folder of the downloaded repository.

  ![Choose folder](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/imohanvadivel/zoho-desk-postman/main/images/Imp_2.png)

- Click the `import` button.

  ![import](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/imohanvadivel/zoho-desk-postman/main/images/Imp_3.png)

- You should now see the Zoho Desk API collection on the Collections pane.

  ![Collection pane](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/imohanvadivel/zoho-desk-postman/main/images/Frk_4.png)

- Update the environment variables with your secret keys and save.

  ![Update Environment Variables](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/imohanvadivel/zoho-desk-postman/main/images/Frk_5.png)

- Set the environment to active.

![Set environment to active](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/imohanvadivel/zoho-desk-postman/main/images/Frk_6.png)

You are now up and running with Zoho Desk API collections.

## Contribute

You can easily contribute to this project by

1. Fork this repo.
2. Import the collection into your Postman workspace and make your contribution in the postman editor itself.
3. Export your collection to overwrite the file in your forked branch.
4. Submit the forked branch as a PR back to this repo.
